Package org.neo4j.storageengine.api

Interface StorageEngineFactory

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    RecordStorageEngineFactory
    public interface StorageEngineFactory
    A factory suitable for something like service-loading to load StorageEngine instances. Also migration logic is provided by this factory.

      • listStorageFiles

        List<Path> listStorageFiles​(FileSystemAbstraction fileSystem,
                            DatabaseLayout databaseLayout)
                     throws IOException
        Lists files of a specific storage location.
        Parameters:
        fileSystem - FileSystemAbstraction this storage is on.
        databaseLayout - DatabaseLayout pointing out its location.
        Returns:
        a List of Path instances for the storage files.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there was no storage in this location.

      • storageExists

        boolean storageExists​(FileSystemAbstraction fileSystem,
                      DatabaseLayout databaseLayout,
                      PageCache pageCache)
        Check if a store described by provided database layout exists in provided file system
        Parameters:
        fileSystem - store file system
        databaseLayout - store database layout
        pageCache - page cache to open store with
        Returns:
        true of store exist, false otherwise

      • checkRecoveryRequired

        StorageFilesState checkRecoveryRequired​(FileSystemAbstraction fs,
                                        DatabaseLayout databaseLayout,
                                        PageCache pageCache)
        Asks this storage engine about the state of a specific store before opening it. If this specific store is missing optional or even perhaps mandatory files in order to properly open it, this is the place to report that.
        Parameters:
        fs - FileSystemAbstraction to use for file operations.
        databaseLayout - DatabaseLayout for the location of the database in the file system.
        pageCache - PageCache for any data reading needs.
        Returns:
        the state of the storage files.

      • commandReaderFactory

        CommandReaderFactory commandReaderFactory()
        Returns:
        a CommandReaderFactory capable of handing out CommandReader for specific versions. Generally kernel will take care of most of the log entry parsing, i.e. the START, COMMIT, CHECKPOINT commands and their contents (they may be versioned). For COMMAND log entries this returned factory will be used to parse the actual command contents, which are storage-specific. For maximum flexibility the structure should be something like this:
        1. 1B log entry version - managed by kernel
        2. 1B log entry type - managed by kernel
        3. For COMMAND log entries: 1B command version - managed by storage
        4. For COMMAND log entries: 1B command type - managed by storage
        5. For COMMAND log entries: command data... - managed by storage
        Although currently it's more like this:
        1. 1B log entry version - dictating both log entry version AND command version
        2. 1B log entry type - managed by kernel
        3. For COMMAND log entries: command data... - managed by storage, although versioned the same as log entry version

      • selectStorageEngine

        static StorageEngineFactory selectStorageEngine()
        Selects a StorageEngineFactory among the candidates. How it's done or which it selects isn't important a.t.m.
        Returns:
        the selected StorageEngineFactory.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if there were no candidates.
